data.title: NetSuite Consultant: What Do They Do & How They Help Your Business?
data.meta_description: Everything you need to know about NetSuite consultants: how they can help drive business growth, job duties, project examples & when to hire.
data.text:
In today’s increasingly competitive business landscape, it’s essential to ensure that whichever NetSuite solutions you plan to implement are not only the right fit for your unique company needs but are also built with sustainability and scalability to help you succeed.

Oftentimes, it can be beneficial (and more effective) to turn to a skilled NetSuite consultant for implementation guidance in order to save time and money while bolstering company growth.

Everything you need to know about NetSuite Consultants:

What is NetSuite?

What does a NetSuite consultant do?

When should you hire a NetSuite consultant?

How can a NetSuite consultant help your business?

Types of projects NetSuite consultants work on, with examples

What is NetSuite?

NetSuite is a cloud-based software that provides companies with better manage and understanding of financial and operational processes and functions. With proprietary tools for automating processes, gathering timely and accurate data, and more, NetSuite is instrumental in saving time, providing insight into company on goings from a single interface, and helping users foresee potential issues before they arise.

What applications does NetSuite include?

Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP)

Customer Resource Management (CRM)

E-commerce

Inventory

Accounting

What does a NetSuite consultant do?

A NetSuite consultant begins by assessing your company, processes and team to identify which NetSuite solutions are the best fit for your needs. Next, they outline operations that are easily transferrable to NetSuite, analyze them for potential risk, and provide a roadmap of your proposed NetSuite adoption strategy.

After adoption takes place, a consultant will work with you and your team to consistently monitor, manage, and optimize your deployment on an ongoing basis, also providing hands-on training and recommendations for additional supporting technologies.

Other skills of NetSuite consultants include:

Managing, developing, evaluating, integrating, and optimizing software

Business process re-engineering

Developing and implementing system design strategies

Conducting infrastructure design and data migration

Working with client databases and managing client on goings

Providing technical and functional support

When should you hire a NetSuite consultant?

If you’re new to NetSuite, hiring a consultant from the get-go is vital to your success. Rather than potentially being misinformed and having to make decisions on the fly, you’ll receive access to a true industry expert who has conducted successful NetSuite implementations for clients in similar situations.

If you’re already up and running on NetSuite, hiring a consultant can be particularly beneficial for improving your current configuration and associated business processes.

It can also be helpful if you’re experiencing a period of rapid business change, such as extreme growth, M&A activities, or preparing to go public.

How can a NetSuite consultant help your business?

Consolidates your accounting, planning, procurement, projects, and analytics endeavors under one platform

Saves you time and money while making the most of your implementation, as many NetSuite consultants can negotiate a lower service price due to their exclusive standing with NetSuite

Allows you to utilize powerful and intuitive tools and methodologies to enable end-to-end business transformations

Gives you better access to and acquisition of important company data, analytics reports, and customer insights

Provides a boost in your team’s productivity as processes are streamlined and performance is measured, fostering more company-wide alignment

Gives you access to hands-on training and post-deployment support to save time and reduce costs while allowing you to make the most of your implementation

Types of projects NetSuite consultants work on, with examples:

The types of projects a NetSuite consultant works on can take many shapes, from automating business processes and analyzing company data to providing hands-on trainings to employees and working with clients and their related databases.

Let’s take a look into one of the Bridgepoint Consulting team’s previous experiences as an example of the type of projects NetSuite consultants are often tasked with. For a more detailed look, please head to our NetSuite implementation case study.

A high-growth SaaS company once came to Bridgepoint to help them prepare for an upcoming acquisition by a leading private equity firm. As part of the acquisition, our client was informed they had to migrate away from QuickBooks to NetSuite — and do so within just 3 months.

Our NetSuite consultants began by conducting the necessary research to best understand our client’s priorities and develop sustainable strategies, eventually deciding to implement ancillary and merchant services within NetSuite alongside billing solutions to help them successfully meet their launch date.

This provided the client with transparent reporting, consolidated financials to present to the PE firm, and an easier acquisition process — all thanks to a successful NetSuite implementation.

Whatever your company needs or situation looks like, NetSuite consultants bring a structured approach to identifying opportunities and outlining a roadmap for bringing these discoveries to life.
